sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of cyber attack occurring on a network
message_1: A certain company has experienced 18 cyber-attacks of a specific type in the last 6 months. What is the probability that the company will experience 3 cyber-attacks of the same type in the next 30 days, given that the frequency of such attacks follows a Poisson distribution with a mean of 5 attacks per month? Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
message_2:
To calculate the probability of experiencing 3 cyber-attacks in the next 30 days, we will use the Poisson distribution formula:

P(x) = (e^(-λ) * λ^x) / x!

Where:
- P(x) is the probability of experiencing x cyber-attacks
- λ is the average number of cyber-attacks per time period (in this case, 5 attacks per month)
- x is the number of cyber-attacks we want to find the probability for (in this case, 3)
- e is the base of the natural logarithm (approximately 2.71828)

Plugging in the values:

P(3) = (e^(-5) * 5^3) / 3!

P(3) = (0.0067 * 125) / 6

P(3) = 0.8375 / 6

P(3) = 0.1396

Rounding to the nearest hundredth, the probability of experiencing 3 cyber-attacks in the next 30 days is approximately 0.14 or 14%.
